abstract: With regulations to address climate change looming, coal power looks increasingly expensive.
snippet: With regulations to address climate change looming, coal power looks increasingly expensive.
lead_paragraph: Last May, protesters took over James E. Rogers’s front lawn in Charlotte, N.C., unfurling banners declaring “No new coal” and erecting a makeshift “green power plant”  which, they said in a press release, was fueled by “the previously unexplored energy source known as hot air, which has been found in large concentrations” at his home.

headline.main: Is America Ready to Quit Coal?
headline.print_headline: Is America Ready to Quit Coal?
